alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 11:02PM EDT until April 09 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...From Friday morning to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 5.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.4 feet on 03/25/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 4.4 Thu 10 p 5.1 4.4 5.4 2pm 4/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1115 AM EDT.
